intro: Chamaenerion subdentatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fireweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and riverbanks. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight serration along the edges. It is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other species known for their striking floral displays.
